snippet: In the early years of Central Park, the dirt path around the reservoir — now commonly called the “runners’ track” — was mostly the domain of walkers — and very few of them, at that.
abstract: Christopher Gray Streetscapes column on the history of Central Park's 'runners' track, a path that has often been crowded with walkers, dog owners and even cyclists; the original intent of the path around the reservoir is unclear.
lead_paragraph: In the early years of Central Park, the dirt path around the reservoir — now commonly called the “runners’ track” — was mostly the domain of walkers — and very few of them, at that.

headline.seo: Central Park/Streetscapes - Changing Times on the Reservoir Path
headline.main: When Walkers Were Weird and Runners Few
headline.print_headline: When Walkers Were Weird and Runners Few
